title: is it possible to autorun VMPlayer with a Sandisk U3?

forumNotes.author: Zoso
forumNotes.content:
Ive read that these U3s can autorun custom ISOs. does anyone know if it is possible for these or other USBs to autorun a virtual machine?  

instead of just a U3 menu popping up (when autoplay is on) it would be really cool to have your own VM turn on!  

with usb boot I can carry my system anywhere but most people dont like it when you need to adjust the bios settings or even reboot with a cd kicker.  

if its possible to just plug in the usb and have a VM start that would be Awesome right there!  

has this been done before?  

thanks

forumNotes.author: Wonko the Sane
forumNotes.content:
> if its possible to just plug in the usb and have a VM start that would be Awesome right there!
Sure, it is possible, but you need to boot a "portable" version (no install) of a VM.  

To check/read:  
[http://www.vbox.me/](http://www.vbox.me/ "External link")  

[http://portableapps.com/node/2174](http://portableapps.com/node/2174 "External link")  

[http://hak5.org/foru...c...d\&pid=55776](http://hak5.org/forums/index.php?showtopic=4786&mode=threaded&pid=55776 "External link")
